keyMoments.title: First Use of No Sword Style: Tatsu Maki
keyMoments.description: Zoro debuts his Mutouryuu (No Sword Style) technique Tatsu Maki, creating a powerful tornado attack that sends Pickles spinning and causes him to accidentally slash Big Pan.
keyMoments.significance: First animated appearance of Zoro's ability to fight effectively without wielding swords, showcasing his versatility as a martial artist beyond just swordsmanship.

keyMoments.title: Combination Attack with Sanji
keyMoments.description: Zoro cooperates with Sanji in the Armée de l'Air Power Shoot combination attack, allowing Sanji to launch him toward Big Pan for the finishing blow.
keyMoments.significance: Rare moment of teamwork between the rivals, demonstrating their ability to work together when necessary.

keyMoments.title: Scores Winning Goal in Groggy Ring
keyMoments.description: Zoro grabs Big Pan and dunks him through the goal, securing victory for the Straw Hats and dealing the Groggy Monsters their first-ever Davy Back Fight loss.
keyMoments.significance: Wins the second round of the Davy Back Fight, giving Luffy the right to reclaim a crew member or item from the Foxy Pirates.

abilities.description: A No Sword Style technique where Zoro creates a powerful tornado attack without wielding any swords.

reveals.information: Can fight effectively without wielding swords using No Sword Style (Mutouryuu)

keyMoments.title: Uses Troisième Hachis
keyMoments.description: Sanji unleashes his Troisième Hachis technique, a devastating kick that sends Hamburg flying between Big Pan's crushing pans.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces a new technique in Sanji's Black Leg Style fighting arsenal.

keyMoments.title: Uses Bouquetière Shot
keyMoments.description: Sanji follows up with the Bouquetière Shot technique, ensuring Hamburg's defeat with another powerful kick.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's ability to chain attacks and adds to his documented techniques.

keyMoments.title: Combination Attack with Zoro
keyMoments.description: Sanji launches Zoro through the air using his Armée de l'Air Power Shoot technique in a rare display of cooperation between the rivals.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that despite constant bickering, Sanji and Zoro can create devastating combo attacks when working together.

abilities.description: A powerful kick technique that sends opponents flying with tremendous force.
A follow-up kick attack in Sanji's Black Leg Style.
A powerful kick used to launch allies or objects through the air, used as a combination attack with Zoro.

keyMoments.title: Chooses Shelly Over Chopper
keyMoments.description: After winning the Groggy Ring, Luffy shocks everyone by choosing to reclaim Tonjit's horse Shelly instead of his crew member Chopper, promising to win the next round and rescue Chopper then.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's compassion for others and confidence in his abilities. This anime-original decision extends the dramatic tension of the Davy Back Fight.
keyMoments.quote: I choose... Shelly! Don't worry Chopper! I'll definitely win the next round and get you back!

reveals.information: Prioritizes helping others even when it delays rescuing his own crew member, showing his compassionate nature and confidence

keyMoments.title: Steals Referee's Cards and Whistle
keyMoments.description: Nami cleverly steals the biased referee's red cards and whistle, preventing him from issuing penalty cards against Zoro and Sanji and leveling the playing field.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Nami's quick thinking and willingness to counter cheating with clever tactics. Her action is crucial to the Straw Hats' victory.

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Not Chosen by Luffy
keyMoments.description: Chopper experiences disappointment when Luffy chooses Shelly instead of him after the Groggy Ring victory, though Luffy promises to rescue him in the next round.
keyMoments.significance: Creates emotional stakes and dramatic tension for the final round of the Davy Back Fight. Chopper must trust in Luffy's promise and abilities.

keyMoments.title: Uses Illegal Weapons in Monster Burger
keyMoments.description: Hamburg pulls out iron clubs as part of the Groggy Monsters' illegal weapon-based Monster Burger attack while the referee looks away.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the Foxy Pirates' willingness to cheat and the unfair tactics Zoro and Sanji must overcome.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Sanji's Troisième Hachis
keyMoments.description: Hamburg is sent flying by Sanji's powerful kick, crashing between Big Pan's crushing pans and being eliminated from the match.
keyMoments.significance: First member of the previously undefeated Groggy Monsters to be taken down.

reveals.information: Suffers first-ever defeat in a Davy Back Fight match along with the Groggy Monsters

keyMoments.title: Uses Illegal Swords in Monster Burger
keyMoments.description: Pickles brandishes two swords as part of the Groggy Monsters' illegal weapon-based Monster Burger attack while the referee ignores the cheating.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the extent of the Foxy Pirates' rule-breaking tactics.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Zoro's No Sword Style
keyMoments.description: Pickles is sent spinning by Zoro's Mutouryuu: Tatsu Maki technique, causing him to accidentally slash Big Pan with his own swords before being defeated.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the effectiveness of Zoro's No Sword Style and contributes to the Groggy Monsters' first defeat.

reveals.information: Suffers first-ever defeat in a Davy Back Fight match along with the Groggy Monsters

keyMoments.title: Uses Giant Metal Pans in Monster Burger
keyMoments.description: Big Pan uses giant metal pans to attempt a crushing attack as part of the Groggy Monsters' illegal Monster Burger technique.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases Big Pan's size and strength as a Wotan (half giant, half fish-man).

keyMoments.title: Dunked Through Goal by Zoro
keyMoments.description: Big Pan is grabbed by Zoro and dunked straight through the goal, ending the match and giving the Straw Hats victory in the Groggy Ring.
keyMoments.significance: Decisive moment that ends the second round and deals the Groggy Monsters their first-ever Davy Back Fight loss.

reveals.information: Suffers first-ever defeat in a Davy Back Fight match along with the Groggy Monsters

keyMoments.title: Reunited with Shelly
keyMoments.description: Tonjit is emotionally reunited with his beloved horse Shelly, whom he had been separated from and who had waited for him for ten years.
keyMoments.significance: Provides emotional payoff for Tonjit's storyline and demonstrates the value of loyalty and perseverance.

relationships.description: Tonjit is Shelly's owner and companion. They were separated for ten years but remain deeply bonded.

evolutionMoments.description: Reunited with Shelly after Luffy chooses to reclaim her from the Foxy Pirates.

keyMoments.title: Chosen by Luffy
keyMoments.description: Shelly is chosen by Luffy as his prize for winning the Groggy Ring, allowing her to be reunited with her owner Tonjit.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's compassion and creates the dramatic setup for the final round where he must rescue Chopper.

keyMoments.title: Reunited with Tonjit
keyMoments.description: Shelly is joyfully reunited with Tonjit after being separated and waiting for him for ten years.
keyMoments.significance: Heartwarming payoff for the loyal horse's decade-long wait and Luffy's decision to help them.

relationships.description: Shelly is Tonjit's horse and loyal companion. She waited for him for ten years and is deeply bonded to him.

evolutionMoments.description: Reunited with Tonjit after Luffy reclaims her from the Foxy Pirates.

keyMoments.title: Has Cards and Whistle Stolen by Nami
keyMoments.description: The biased referee Itomimizu has his red cards and whistle stolen by Nami, preventing him from issuing penalty cards against the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.significance: Removes the referee's ability to unfairly penalize Zoro and Sanji, leveling the playing field.
